snippet: The agency is frowning on a plan that promises that the insurance contribution a company makes to its employees’ coverage is tax-free for the employees and excluded from payroll taxes for the employer.
abstract: You're the Boss blog; Zane Benefits offers businesses an online insurance claims reimbursement service and allows them to create defined contribution health plans that may run afoul of guidelines issued by Internal Revenue Service; Zane Benefits president Rick Lindquist says plan does not violate any rules, even though IRS has warned about health reimbursement arrangements.
lead_paragraph: The agency is frowning on a plan that promises that the insurance contribution a company makes to its employees’ coverage is tax-free for the employees and excluded from payroll taxes for the employer.

headline.main: Risking a Health Insurance Strategy the I.R.S. May Not Approve
headline.print_headline: Risking a Health Insurance Strategy the I.R.S. May Not Approve
